senses.de: To make a mistake by confusing or misunderstanding something or someone.
senses.ex: I apologize for the error, I mixed up the dates.

Tips.title: Easily Confused
Tips.description: Common in situations where similar items or events are involved, making it easy to confuse them.
Tips.example: Be careful not to mix up the twins' names at their birthday party.

Tips.title: Apologetic Tone
Tips.description: Often used to admit a mistake politely, especially in professional or formal contexts.
Tips.example: I must mix up my apologies; my previous email mentioned the incorrect project name.

senses.de: To combine or blend different things or ingredients in no specific order.
senses.ex: She mixed up the fruits and created a new smoothie recipe.

Tips.title: Creativity Encouraged
Tips.description: Suggests experimentation and combining elements in new ways, especially in cooking or art.
Tips.example: Feel free to mix up the paint colors to find the perfect shade for your canvas.

Tips.title: Casual Activity
Tips.description: Implies a more relaxed approach without focusing on precision or order when combining things.
Tips.example: Just mix up those leftover vegetables from the fridge to make a stir-fry.

senses.de: To involve someone in a difficult situation or a problem unintentionally.
senses.ex: He got mixed up in a case of fraud without realizing it.

Tips.title: Unintentional Involvement
Tips.description: Highlights the lack of intention when someone becomes part of a problematic situation.
Tips.example: She never wanted to, but somehow she got mixed up with the wrong crowd.

Tips.title: Serious Consequences
Tips.description: Conveys that being mixed up in something bad can have serious, unintended consequences.
Tips.example: I warned him not to get mixed up in those shady business deals.

senses.de: To change the order of things so it's not organized anymore, or hard to understand.
senses.ex: My little sister mixed up all my papers on the desk.

Tips.title: Disorganization Results
Tips.description: Used when things were orderly but have become jumbled, making it hard to sort out.
Tips.example: After the kids play, they always mix up the toy box contents.

Tips.title: Sorting Out Needed
Tips.description: Implies that extra effort is required to return the mixed up items to their proper state.
Tips.example: After the paperwork mix up, it took hours to sort out the files.
